title: 111_hr1881
content:
The "Transportation Security Workforce Enhancement Act of 2009" includes sections on definitions, conversion of transportation security personnel, transition rules, consultation requirement, no right to strike, regulations, delegations to Assistant Secretary, and authorization of appropriations. The "Transportation Security Workforce Enhancement Act of 2009" defines key terms such as "covered position" within the Transportation Security Administration and the Department of Homeland Security, "covered employee," "employee," "Secretary," and "Assistant Secretary." The "Transportation Security Workforce Enhancement Act of 2009" defines key terms related to security, including the roles of the Assistant Secretary within the Department of Homeland Security and the TSA personnel management system. The "Transportation Security Workforce Enhancement Act of 2009" defines key terms related to security, including the roles of the Assistant Secretary within the Department of Homeland Security and the TSA personnel management system. The term "agency" refers to an Executive agency as defined by section 105 of title 5, United States Code, and the term "conversion date" is the date when certain sections take effect. SEC. 3. CONVERSION OF TRANSPORTATION SECURITY PERSONNEL. Effective as of the enactment of this Act, certain personnel authorities will be terminated, including the repeal of specific laws and the termination of TSA personnel management systems. Covered employees and positions will be subject to the same personnel management system as civil service employees. All TSA personnel management systems will cease to be effective within 60 days of the enactment of this Act. All TSA personnel management systems will cease to be effective, and covered employees and positions will become subject to the provisions of title 5, United States Code, and other civil service laws. Employees and positions within agencies, excluding the Department of Homeland Security, will be subject to title 5, United States Code, and other civil service laws. SEC. 4. TRANSITION RULES. Transition rules for employees converting from a TSA personnel management system to applicable law ensure no reduction in pay and preserve all rights and benefits accrued before the conversion date. Transition rules ensure no reduction in pay and preserve accrued rights and benefits for employees converting to applicable law. This includes severance pay, accrued leave, and health insurance premiums remaining the same for employees continuously employed by the Department of Homeland Security. No impact on pending proceedings before the conversion date. Any ongoing administrative or judicial proceedings before the enactment of this Act will continue unaffected by the new law. Determinations and appeals in these proceedings will proceed as if the Act had not been enacted. SEC. 5. CONSULTATION REQUIREMENT. (a) A qualified labor organization is defined as one that meets the criteria of a labor organization under section 7103(a)(4) of title 5, United States Code, and receives dues from at least 1,000 covered employees through payroll deductions. 
(b) The organization must be informed by the Secretary within 14 days of the enactment of the Act about plans for the conversion of covered employees and positions, including the proposed conversion date. The labor organization must be informed about plans for employee conversion and compliance measures. They have the right to present their views and recommendations, which the Secretary must consider before taking final action. The Secretary must provide a written statement of reasons for final actions. The provisions of this section allow for the application of subsections (b) or (c) if a labor organization has exclusive recognition or to limit collective bargaining rights. The section will cease to be effective as of the conversion date. SEC. 6. NO RIGHT TO STRIKE. This Act does not affect existing laws on disloyalty, loyalty, and striking. SEC. 7. REGULATIONS. The Secretary can create regulations to implement this Act. SEC. 8. DELEGATIONS TO ASSISTANT SECRETARY. SEC. 8. DELEGATIONS TO ASSISTANT SECRETARY. The Secretary can delegate authority or function to the Assistant Secretary as deemed appropriate. SEC. 9. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Sums may be appropriated as necessary for this Act.
